elements.title: wind power in Turkey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that wind power in Turkey (turbine pictured) is so profitable that companies pay the government for licences?

elements.title: E. Virgil Neal (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that E. Virgil Neal was a teacher, stage hypnotist, fraudster and finally a wealthy cosmetics manufacturer?

elements.title: any port in a storm (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first known publication of the phrase "any port in a storm" was in a 1749 erotic novel?

elements.title: Benny Lefebvre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Benny Lefebvre had three sons who signed professional baseball contracts and four brothers who played football?

elements.title: Vegeta (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Vegeta is used to attack HTTP-based applications?

elements.title: Ted Decker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Home Depot CEO Ted Decker ran his own landscaping business in high school?

elements.title: Mass cards (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in Ireland, selling unauthorized Mass cards could lead to 10 years in jail or a €300,000 fine?

elements.title: hurricane (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that someone once paid $750 to enjoy a hurricane?
